item.title: Investigating object orientation effects across 14 languages
item.description:
Video demonstration of the procedure followed in our lab

Reference

Chen, S., Szabelska, A., Chartier, C. R., Kekecs, Z., Lynott, D., Bernabeu, P., … Schmidt, K. (conditionally accepted). Investigating object orientation effects across 14 languages. Psychonomic Bulletin and Review. https://doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/t2pjv/

item.title: Dutch modality exclusivity norms for 336 properties and 411 concepts
item.description:
Reference

Bernabeu, P. (2018). Dutch modality exclusivity norms for 336 properties and 411 concepts [Unpublished manuscript]. School of Humanities, Tilburg University, the Netherlands. https://psyarxiv.com/s2c5h.

item.title: Modality switch effects emerge early and increase throughout conceptual processing: evidence from ERPs
item.description:
Bonus: a conference poster with further analyses  

Reference

Bernabeu, P., Willems, R. M., & Louwerse, M. M. (2017). Modality switch effects emerge early and increase throughout conceptual processing: Evidence from ERPs. In G. Gunzelmann, A. Howes, T. Tenbrink, & E. J. Davelaar (Eds.), Proceedings of the 39th Annual Conference of the Cognitive Science Society (pp. 1629-1634). Austin, TX: Cognitive Science Society. https://mindmodeling.org/cogsci2017/papers/0318/
